intro: Mozinna spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaf mozinna, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible rhubarb-like stems. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
